title: Mixing patterns in a match expression can lead to conflicting warnings / errors

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

body:
## Summary
Mixing multiple patterns and a binding can lead to conflicting warnings or errors.

## Examples
```rust
match self.get_char() {
  ch @ '.' | ch @ '0' ... '9' => { ... },
  _ => { ... }
}
```
... will lead to the following warning ...
```
warning: unused variable: `ch`
   --> examples/file.rs:145:13
 |
 |             ch @ '.' | ch @ '0' ... '9' => {
 |             ^^^^^^^^
 |
```

**However,**
```rust
match self.get_char() {
  '.' | ch @ '0' ... '9' => { ... },
  _ => { ... }
}
```
... will lead to the following error ...
```
error[E0408]: variable `ch` is not bound in all patterns
   --> examples/file.rs:145:13
 |
 |             '.' | ch @ '0' ... '9' => {
 |             ^^^   -- variable not in all patterns
 |             |
 |             pattern doesn't bind `ch`
```
... which makes sense.

The error is logical, but in this case, no warning should be generated.

## Personal note
I think the problem comes from the [Liveness analysis](/rust-lang/rust/blob/d86a7f7a78e96bd28468e165c2b223b3b6ecc11d/src/librustc/middle/liveness.rs#L1411-L1526), but I don't know what each function does, and I thus can't say for sure.
